p: Abiotic stress factors also lead to substantial changes of plant communities, affecting biodiversity and organismal interactions. Particularly salinity affects soil microbial biodiversity [ 16] and shapes plant communities by benefiting slow growing halophytes over glycophytes [ 17]. Next, the arbuscular mycorrhizal symbiosis is also largely affected [ 18], as well as plant susceptibility to various diseases, which may either increase [ 19] or decrease [ 20].
